clinical_study.brief_title: Nivolumab in Patients With Type B3 Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma (NIVOTHYM)
clinical_study.official_title: Single-arm, Multicentre, Phase II Study of Immunotherapy in Patients With Type B3 Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma Previously Treated With Chemotherapy

lead_sponsor.agency: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - EORTC

clinical_study.source: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - EORTC

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the phase II Nivothym study is to collect data on activity and toxicity of nivolumab therapy in patients with thymic carcinoma or type B3 thymoma that previously received a first platinum-based chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival Rate (PFSR) at month 6
primary_outcome.time_frame: The Progression Free Survival Rate (PFSR) analysis will be performed at month 6

secondary_outcome.description: This study will use the International Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), version 4.03, for adverse event reporting.
Overall Response Rate (ORR) will be measured according to RECIST 1.1

arm_group.description: Patients will be centrally registered and will receive nivolumab 240 mg IV every 2 weeks

intervention.description: Patients will be centrally registered and will receive nivolumab 240 mg IV every 2 weeks
